qas.question: How many Germans were living in East Prussia in 1945?
Around how many camps were set up by the Germans during the way?
How many forced labourers were in the largest camp?
What were the children that were left behind in East Prussia that was occupied by the Russians referred to as?
How many Germans were prevented from returning to East Prussia?
How many Wolf children were there?
How many forced labourers were there in the smallest camp?
Where was the smallest camp established?
In what year was the first forced labour camp established?

context: Shortly after the end of the war in May <b8_0>1945<b8_0/>, Germans who had fled in early 1945 tried to return to their homes in East Prussia. An estimated number of <a0_0><b4_0>800,000<b4_0/><a0_0/> Germans were living in East Prussia during the summer of 1945. Many more were prevented from returning,[citation needed] and the German population of East Prussia was almost completely expelled by the communist regimes. During the war and for some time thereafter <a1_0>45 camps<a1_0/> were established for about 200,000-250,000 forced labourers, the vast majority of whom were deported to the Soviet Union, including the Gulag camp system. The largest camp with about <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>48,000<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> inmates was established at <b7_0>Deutsch Eylau<b7_0/> (Iława). Orphaned children who were left behind in the zone occupied by the Soviet Union were referred to as <a3_0>Wolf children<a3_0/>.
